titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Alice Park papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Grace M. Hawes

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-11-02T17:09-0700

change.item: Updated encoding to include accrual statement and acquisition information by Samira Bozorgi.
Encoding revised and photo card file info added.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Alice Park Papers)//EN" "parkalic.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: Diaries, correspondence, pamphlets, clippings, leaflets, and peace buttons relating to pacifism and the peace movement, the Ford Peace Ship Expedition, feminism, socialism, the labor movement, prison reform, child labor legislation, civil liberties, and a variety of other reform movements in the United States.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items, computer media, and digital files. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Alice Park papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1930, with increments received at later dates.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note*

chronitem.event: Born, Boston, Massachusetts
Graduated, Rhode Island State Normal School
Married Dean W. Park
Active in the international feminist movement
Active in various peace societies
Active leader in the women's suffrage movement
Attended Women's Suffrage Convention, Portland, Oregon
Author, California Bird and Arbor Day Law
Attended Women's Suffrage Convention, Seattle, Washington
Author, California law for equal guardianship of parents of minor children
Delegate, International Woman's Suffrage Alliance, Budapest, Hungary
Delegate, International Peace Congress at The Hague, Netherlands
Member, Ford Peace Expedition
Attended National Suffrage Convention, Washington, D.C.
Attended International Peace Conference, Washington, D.C.
Delegate, Women's International League for Peace and Freedom, Dublin, Ireland
Attended International Woman's Suffrage Alliance, Paris, France
Attended International Vegetarian Convention, London, England
Attended International League for Peace and Freedom, Duisburg, Germany
Attended National Peace Convention, York, England
Attended Pan-American Congress, Havana, Cuba
Died

bioghist.p: *: See Una R. Winter (ed.). Alice Park of California: Worker for Woman Suffrage and for Children's Rights. Upland, California: Susan B. Anthony Memorial Committee of California, 1948. Hoover Institution Library Call Number: HQ1413 P2W787

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Diaries, correspondence, pamphlets, clippings, leaflets, and peace buttons relating to pacifism and the peace movement, the Ford Peace Ship Expedition, feminism, socialism, the labor movement, prison reform, child labor legislation, civil liberties, and a variety of other reform movements in the United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Articles, pamphlets, correspondence, and newspaper clippings, arranged alphabetically by title or subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Unpublished typewritten manuscript (2 copies) and related materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets, leaflets, and other printed matter, arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: 1 print of Hannah Sheehy-Skeffinton; 1 print of Warren K. Billings; 2 prints of Rosika Schwimmer; 1 print of Rosika Schwimmer with Louis Calhern, Dorothy Gish, and Edgar Barrier; 1 print of Elizabeth Cady Stanton; 1 print of Florence Holbrook and Lola Maverick Lloyd; 1 print of Heart Mountain, Wyoming, Japanese Internment Camp; 4 prints of child laborers; 3 prints of John E. Jones; 3 miscellaneous prints,
74 peace postcards; 5 Industrial Worker of the World postcards,
1 illustrated chart of the members of the U.S. Congress who voted against American entry into World War I,
